image.altText: A single-story house with a large gum tree branch fallen on the roof, causing damage.

props.synopsis: After a tree branch that Canberra resident Terrylea Reynolds had repeatedly reported as being dangerous fell on her house, she's hopeful a law update will help stop the same thing happening to others.

title.children: Terrylea reported a concerning tree. Then its branch fell on her house

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The two men are accused of sexually assaulting a woman they both knew in the family home of one of the accused.

title.children: Accused granted bail after alleged rape in family home

image.altText: Andrew Barr press conference

props.synopsis: The federal opposition's assurance it won't pursue forced redundancies to reduce the size of the public service is met with scepticism from its political opponents in the ACT.

title.children: 'I don't believe them': Barr criticises Coalition public service policy

image.altText: Woman wearing a black t-shirt in a gym using a leg press machine.

props.synopsis: For many people who live with migraine, exercise has been reported as a trigger for attacks. But studies also show that exercise can be prescribed as a non-medical treatment that could decrease their frequency, intensity and attack duration.

title.children: For people with migraine, exercise is a 'double-edged sword'

image.altText: TAX CUTS Peter Dutton, Jane Hume, Angus Taylor 20240206_012902354_iOS

props.synopsis: Jane Hume joked that the private sector might follow the Liberals in cracking down on work from home, but the party ran into trouble when voters came to fear the same.

title.children: How Dutton's work-from-home crackdown came undone

image.altText: Artist's impression of a building with people walking in front.

props.synopsis: The federal and ACT governments would split the cost of early works for a new convention and entertainment centre in Canberra if Labor is re-elected next month.

title.children: Labor promises $100m for Canberra convention centre if re-elected

image.altText: Rohan Goyne in a blue-gray polo shirt with the collar turned up, sitting down and holding papers

props.synopsis: GP bulk billing rates in the ACT have declined since the pandemic, and federal government figures have cast doubt on whether a national target to bulk bill nine out of ten GP visits will be met.

title.children: Rohan struggles to pay GP bills. He's hoping that will change

image.altText: Trump waves as he walks across a lawn in a jacket

props.synopsis: It may be the world's largest economy, the global military superpower. But America is beset with problems.

title.children: Why America will be the biggest loser in Trump's tariff war

image.altText: A man in a royal blue suit, white shirt and light blue tie sits in a room with red carpet looking toward something out of frame

props.synopsis: Beijing says Donald Trump's tariffs will increase the divide between rich and poor nations, as countries across the region grapple with what to do next.

title.children: 'China's economy is an ocean': Xi unfazed by Trump tariffs

image.altText: Three women standing together.

props.synopsis: For residents of Altadena, hopes of rebuilding their community just as it was are facing mounting challenges.

title.children: In fire-ravaged LA, a land grab threatens to change the face of the city

image.altText: A line chart shows share prices falling after the announcement of tariffs.

props.synopsis: Share markets around the world take a battering as Donald Trump's new tariff regime creates a wave of uncertainty.

title.children: Stock Market tracker: See how ASX and US stocks are faring under Trump

image.altText: Michele Bullock at microphone at RBA press conference

props.synopsis: The new US tariffs have wreaked havoc on global markets but there could be a silver lining for Australian homeowners, with the big four banks changing their bets on when the RBA could deliver the next rate cut.

title.children: Economic meltdown could see interest rates fall to under 3pc

image.altText: An aerial shot of a town surrounded by water

props.synopsis: The NSW State Emergency Service is responding to ongoing flooding as flows from Queensland cause river rises to pass historic levels.

title.children: Residents isolated as record flooding hits western NSW

image.altText: Seth

props.synopsis: Members of Australia's biggest superannuation fund say they asked about a key safeguard against online fraud before cyber thieves stole retirement savings.

title.children: Customers asked super fund about security weakness before cyberattacks

image.altText: smoke bellows out of a volcano after it erupts

props.synopsis: Kanlaon Volcano, one of 24 active volcanoes in the Philippines, has erupted, with social media videos showing a plume of ash rising into the sky.

title.children: Ash soars kilometres into air as Philippines volcano erupts

image.altText: A man in combat gear walks over sand towards a damaged apartment building

props.synopsis: Five witnesses tell the ABC that multiple civilians were targeted and killed by the IDF when they were supposed to have safe passage out of the city of Tel Al-Sultan.

title.children: As Abir fled her home on IDF orders, she said she made a horror discovery

image.altText: A man watches on during a cricket match

props.synopsis: Former batting prodigy Will Pucovski has called time on his cricket career at age 27 after dealing with difficult symptoms following his most recent concussion.

title.children: Will Pucovski announces retirement following 'scary' concussion symptoms

image.altText: King Charles and Queen Camilla interlock their arms and smile to the camera

props.synopsis: The royals are photographed at Villa Wolkonsky, the British ambassador's residence in Rome.

title.children: Charles and Camilla mark 20th anniversary with photos in Rome

image.altText: An aerial view of a wharf part of the Darwin Port, with the city of Darwin in the distance.

props.synopsis: A former NT minister has defended the 99-year lease of the Darwin port to a Chinese-owned company, as both the Coalition and Labor promise to return it to Australian hands.

title.children: ‘China was the Asian tiger’: Darwin port 99-year lease deal defended

image.altText: An intricate golden star shape above capital letters that spell out "The Star" advertising a casino.

props.synopsis: Star has warned for months it could fall into administration if a financier wasn't found and has now reached a deal with Bally's, after a separate refinancing deal fell over.

title.children: Star Entertainment signs $300m lifeline deal with US gaming giant

props.synopsis: Paris Tier, the partner of GWS defender Conor Stone, found herself in her GP’s office asking to go on Ozempic after receiving online hate comments about her weight.

title.children: AFL partners divulge ‘lifelong body dysmorphia’ from online trolling

image.altText: A grey-colouered tadpole close up with little round black eggs in its mouth, hovering over sandy-coloured small rocks.

props.synopsis: By removing a gene to stunt cane toads at their tadpole stage, scientists hope they may have found a way to make the invader kill its own species.

title.children: Cannibal cane toad tadpoles that never grow up could help toad control

image.altText: A coach talks to his players during a football match

props.synopsis: With the 2026 Asian Cup fast approaching, Football Australia is expected to step up its search for a permanent new coach for the Matildas after Steph Catley admitted the side was "in limbo" after 11 matches under interim manager Tom Sermanni.

title.children: Matildas 'in limbo' as search for permanent coach continues

image.altText: Five staff members of a resort stand on the beach and wave happily with their left hands

props.synopsis: The villas are locked, the boats have set sail, the body bag has been zipped: The White Lotus is off-season for another year. Here's where it left us.

title.children: What’s next for The White Lotus after last night’s explosive finale?

image.altText: Clem Burke having his photo taken in a red shirt

props.synopsis: The musician has been remembered by his band mates for his "talent, energy and passion".

title.children: Clem Burke, drummer and 'the heartbeat' of Blondie, dies aged 70

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu and Donald Trump grinning while shaking hands and sitting in golden chairs in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu announces he will look to "eliminate" the US-Israel trade deficit, saying the move can be a model for how other countries should respond to Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.

title.children: Israel to 'eliminate' US trade barriers but Trump won't pause tariffs

image.altText: a view of St Patrick's Catholic cathedral in East Melbourne

props.synopsis: A multi-billion-dollar insurance valuation of Melbourne's Catholic church buildings has been made public by Victoria's Aboriginal truth-telling inquiry, despite a church application for property value details to be suppressed.

title.children: Value of churches built on 'stolen land' worth more than $3b, inquiry told

image.altText: An old Palestinian man stands at a lectern with news microphones in front of him.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Red Crescent Society releases more video of the moments before Israeli forces opened fire on a convoy of paramedics and emergency workers.

title.children: Israeli probe into medic killings can't be trusted, Red Crescent says

image.altText: forensics officers taking pictures at a crime scene in a laneway in Moe.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Homicide Squad is investigating the deaths of an elderly man in Cowes and an unidentified man who died in Moe.

title.children: Homicide detectives investigate two suspicious deaths in Gippsland

image.altText: A man standing on a bitumen street wearing a button up shirt and large hat, he has a serious expression on his face

props.synopsis: Queensland MP Robbie Katter wants state-owned corporation Powerlink dropped from the construction of a major transmission line as the government unveils how it will "save" the project.

title.children: Outback power line cost blows out from $1.8 billion to nearly $14 billion

image.altText: Two men standing on the verge of the Tomingley open cut gold mine.

props.synopsis: The spot prices of gold have never been higher, topping $5,000 an ounce for the first time last week. That has Australian miners ramping up production, trying to take advantage of lofty price forecasts.

title.children: Inside Australia's new gold rush as miners cash in on record prices

image.altText: Golfer Adam Scott holds his golf ball up in acknowledgement of the crowd after a hole at The Masters.

props.synopsis: Former Masters champion Adam Scott wants to win another big event — and scratch the Presidents Cup itch — as he approaches a century of consecutive major starts.

title.children: Time running out for Adam Scott to win multiple majors

image.altText: Group of business professionals walking together in the city.

props.synopsis: Experts explain what's reasonable when it comes to a workplace dress code and how enforceable they are.

title.children: Your rights when it comes to what you can wear at work

image.altText: A woman with brown hair sits at a sunny desk with her eyes closed, massaging her temples

props.synopsis: Dealing with perimenopause symptoms can be confusing. Our health experts will be here on Friday April 11 to answer questions about how to navigate this phase of life.

title.children: Perimenopause has a big impact on your life. Ask our health experts your questions

image.altText: Men and women wearing red doctor shirts while holding signs and protesting.

props.synopsis: The industrial action centres around claims of unsustainable workloads, chronic understaffing and low pay, with the union expecting up to 9,000 doctors to take part.

title.children: Thousands of public hospital doctors walk-off job in NSW
